ABOUT.LABEL: About eBlocker
ABOUT.TEAM: We have spent many years designing, developing, testing and improving eBlockerOS. Today we are proud that our idea is gaining more and more supporters. eBlockerOS is Open Source, has no backdoors, is completely free of charge and being developed together with the community.
ABOUT.THANK_YOU: Thank you very much for using eBlockerOS. You have made a very good decision to protect your privacy and your entire family.
ABOUT.NON_PROFIT: eBlocker is a non-profit project, financed by donations and supported by a community of volunteers. eBlocker is not a large company, but the commitment of an interdisciplinary team of privacy specialists, data protection experts and IT security experts around the initiators Christian Bennefeld and Boris Prinz.
ABOUT.DONATE: To ensure eBlockerOS is secure in the long term, gets regular updates and new features, we need your help. Please support us with your contribution in the community or a donation:
ABOUT.DONATE_THANKS: As a gratitude for your donation, you will receive a license key to get automatic daily updates. In addition we are able to realize our idea of a free internet without mass surveillance in the long run. Thank you so much!
ABOUT.COMMUNITY: If you have any questions, new ideas or found errors, please solely use our forum at

CAPTIVE_PORTAL.LABEL: Captive Portal Check
CAPTIVE_PORTAL.TEXT1: The Google Captive Portal Check is used by Google products like Android, Chrome, Chromebooks and Chromium to determine if you are connected to internet by sending your IP address and other data as a request to Google.
CAPTIVE_PORTAL.TEXT2: eBlocker blocks these requests in order to hide your IP address from Google.
CAPTIVE_PORTAL.TEXT3: Enable this option if your Android device drops the WLAN connection frequently.
CAPTIVE_PORTAL.TITLE: Google Captive Portal Check

TAB_1.INTRO_1: If this function is activated, the eBlocker will terminate all encrypted HTTPS connections and re-encrypt them towards the targeted server. This is needed to allow the eBlocker to monitor all HTTPS connections.
TAB_1.INTRO_2: Please be aware that the individual eBlocker certificate must be added to all browsers used.
TAB_1.INTRO_3: In case you use apps, like Facebook or Twitter, or online games, please activate the respective exemption list for these apps on the tab TRUSTED APPS.

DO_NOT_TRACK.LABEL: Do-Not-Track
DO_NOT_TRACK.TEXT1: Do-Not-Track (DNT) is an HTTP header field that informs a website that the visitor requests the website to not generate a usage profile.
DO_NOT_TRACK.TEXT2: Unfortunately, this request is not binding and many websites ignore this header field.
DO_NOT_TRACK.TEXT3: Nevertheless, the eBlocker sets this field in all outgoing requests, unless you deactivate it explicitly here.
DO_NOT_TRACK.TITLE: Do-Not-Track

DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_DEFAULT_PROFILE_DESCRIP: This protection profile is automatically assigned to all existing and new devices.
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_FRAG_FINN_PROFILE_DESCR: This profile allows access to german web sites to be suitable for children as determined by fragFINN e.V.
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_FULL_2_PROFILE_DESCRIPT: This profile is used as an example for kids that have access to their own devices (e.g., tablet-child1). Websites with inappropriate content is blocked permanently (e.g., pornography, violence, social networks, games and video portals). Internet access is restricted to 1 hour per day and is only possible between 7AM to 8PM.
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_FULL_2_PROFILE_NAME: Example protection profile for kids with maximum usage time per day
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_FULL_PROFILE_DESCRIPTIO: Full protection without temporal limitation. The device should not be available for free access.
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_MED_2_PROFILE_DESCRIPTI: This profile is used as an example for teens that have access to their own devices (e.g. smartphone-child1). Websites with inappropriate categories (e.g., pornography, violence, gambling, etc.) are blocked permanently. Apart from that, the Internet can be accessed up to 2 hours per day in the week and 3 hours on weekends. This includes social networks, online game portals and video portals. Time frames have been set for Internet access. On weekends a longer Internet access is allowed.
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_MED_2_PROFILE_NAME: Example protection profile for teens with maximum usage time per day
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_MED_PROFILE_DESCRIPTION: Strong protection with one hour per day access to social networks, video- and online portals.
DEFAULT_PROFILE.PARENTAL_CONTROL_MED_PROFILE_NAME: Example protection profile for Teenager with own Device

SSL_FAILS.RECORDING_DESCRIPTION:
Sometimes, apps or websites do not function correctly, when the eBlocker monitors their encrypted communication.
In order to detect and solve problems related to HTTPS communication failures, eBlocker can record these failures.
These recordings can be very helpful to identify affected apps and websites.
HTTPS communication failures can be a hint that certain apps or websites do not function correctly, while the eBlocker monitors their encrypted communication.
SSL_FAILS.RECORDING_RECORDED: Your eBlocker recorded HTTPS communication failures. If you trust the related websites, you can mark the apps as trusted or add the websites to the list of trusted websites. Your eBlocker will not attempt to monitor any encrypted communication with trusted websites.

SWITCH.RECORDING_DISABLED: Recording of HTTPS communication failures disabled
SWITCH.RECORDING_ENABLED: Recording of HTTPS communication failures enabled

SSL_FAILS.DESCRIPTION_NO_ERRORS: No HTTPS communication failures recorded so far.
SSL_FAILS.DESCRIPTION_RECORDED: Your eBlocker recorded the following HTTPS communication failures.
SSL_FAILS.LABEL: Communication Failures
SSL_FAILS.TITLE: HTTPS Communication Failures

SSL_STATUS.ATA_TEXT: Review the trusted domains added by Auto Trust App
SSL_STATUS.LABEL_TEXT_OFF:
If you enable this feature, you must be familiar with advanced settings of your devices and install an encryption certificate on the devices to let eBlocker analyze the data stream.
Activating HTTPS support enables advanced functions of the eBlocker.
SSL_STATUS.IMPORTANT_NOTE: Important: you must add the eBlocker certificate to all activated devices!
SSL_STATUS.INFO_1: We suggest to enable HTTPS support for all standard computers like laptops and desktop PCs and also for tablets and smartphones.
SSL_STATUS.INFO_2: You must add the eBlocker certificate to your devices' operation systems, for which HTTPS support has been enabled. In addition, the certificate must also be added to some apps, like Firefox.
SSL_STATUS.INFO_3: In case you don't want the eBlocker to monitor encrypted connections to trusted sites, e.g. banks, we recommend to put the respective URLs or domains to the exemption list for trusted websites.
SSL_STATUS.INFO_4: In case an app does not function correctly, if HTTPS support is switched on, you can mark this app as trusted in the list of trusted apps (if available) or you can create a new trusted app by adding the relevant domains.
SSL_STATUS.LABEL: Status

STEP_ACCESS.HEADER: Accessing the home network while out of home
STEP_ACCESS.MORE1: Your eBlocker and your home network must be accessible from the Internet. For this purpose, you need either a fixed IP address - which is normally not available for private users - or a defined DNS name, which is automatically assigned to your dynamic IP address.
STEP_ACCESS.MORE2: Such a DNS name for dynamic IP addresses - also called "Dynamic DNS" or DDNS is available from different providers.
STEP_ACCESS.MORE3: For your first steps into eBlocker Mobile, we also provide such a service for you. But please note that availability of this service cannot be guaranteed. It's intended for test use only!

OPTION.DYN_DNS: I already use a Dynamic DNS provider for my dynamic IP address.
OPTION.EBLOCKER_DYN: I want to use eBlocker Dynamic DNS (demo operation).
OPTION.FIXED_IP: I'm using a static IP address.

STEP_ACCESS.TEXT1: How can your home network and your eBlocker be accessed from outside your locale network?

STEP_CHOOSE_PORT_MAPPING.MORE1: Please note that only one specific port on your eBlocker will be accessible from the Internet. This port is secured by state-of-the-art authentication measures to allow access only from your own mobile devices.
STEP_CHOOSE_PORT_MAPPING.MORE2: The communication between your devices and your eBlocker is securely encrypted.
STEP_CHOOSE_PORT_MAPPING.MORE3: No other device, service or application within your local network will be accessible through this port.

OPTION.AUTO: Let eBlocker try to map the router ports (using UPnP)
OPTION.MANUAL: I will do the port mapping myself.

STEP_CHOOSE_PORT_MAPPING.TEXT1: The eBlocker Mobile port must be mapped to an external port on your router, so that it can be accessed from outside.

STEP_CONNECTION_TEST.MORE1: We will try to create a connection from the eBlocker server to your device. This process can take a few seconds.

NOTIFICATION.TEST_ERROR: Your eBlocker could not be reached from the Internet.
NOTIFICATION.TEST_HOSTNAME_FAILURE: Your eBlocker's hostname can not be resolved from the Internet.
NOTIFICATION.TEST_HOSTNAME_SUCCESS: Your eBlocker's hostname can be resolved from the Internet.
NOTIFICATION.TEST_SUCCESS: Your eBlocker can be accessed from the Internet.

STEP_CONNECTION_TEST.TEXT1: We can now test, if your eBlocker can be accessed from the Internet.

AUTO.TEXT2: Whether this is possible or not, depends on your router and its configuration. Most modern routers support UPnP, but it might be switched off for security reasons.

STEP_WELCOME.TEXT2: The setup consists of a few steps. You can interrupt the setup process at any time and continue later!

WEB_COMPRESSION.LABEL: Compression

MODE.VPN_CLIENTS_ONLY: Only for remote devices that are connected over eBlocker Mobile (recommended)

WEB_COMPRESSION.TEXT: eBlocker needs to decompress web pages and javascript files to insert its icon or filter webrtc requests. Afterwards it can re-compress the content again but this may introduce a small delay. In local networks there is no speed gain from compression so this extra delay can be avoided by disabling compression. eBlocker mobile users may benefit from re-compression as those responses have to be transmitted back to their devices over the internet.
WEB_COMPRESSION.TITLE: Compression

WEB_RTC.LABEL: WebRTC
WEB_RTC.TEXT1: WebRTC is a browser technology that enables real time communication by establishing peer to peer connections. This is useful for applications like VoIP/internet calls and chats.
WEB_RTC.TEXT2: Unfortunately WebRTC reveals your real IP address (and even your local LAN IP) to establish the connections. Even when using Tor (IP-anonymization) or a VPN your real IP address is visible when using WebRTC and it can be used to identify you.
WEB_RTC.TITLE: WebRTC

ADDITIONAL.P1: Tor is subject to a few restrictions, as it is made available from a private source.
ADDITIONAL.P3_PRE: For more information, please see the
ADDITIONAL.P4_POST: Thanks to your donation, the anonymization network of volunteers will be maintained.
ADDITIONAL.P4_PRE: If you like Tor, please support the Tor project with

DETAILS.P1: The eBlocker automatically selects the best route and the best Tor exit nodes. If you wish to limit the Tor exit nodes to certain countries, you can select the corresponding menu item on the Tor network page and specify the countries that you want to use as the starting point for your request to the web servers. You can call up specific countries via the search mask, search directly in the list and select them with a mouse click.

OVERVIEW.P1: If you use the eBlocker IP anonymization, you will receive an IP address from another county. This allows you to bypass censorship or access content that is only available in certain regions of the world.
OVERVIEW.P2: You can switch the use of the Tor network on and off via the eBlocker toolbar and the corresponding map in the Overview / Dashboard.
OVERVIEW.P3: In the eBlocker menu under IP Anonymization you can specify whether the Tor network may use all Tor exit nodes or only one of the countries specified.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Tor

DETAILS.P1: As you select "{{ 'ADMINCONSOLE.VPN_CONNECT.ACTION.ADD_BUTTON' | translate }}", the wizard for new VPN connections opens, there you have to upload the OpenVPN configuration file(s) of your VPN provider. The eBlocker checks all settings of the script and discards some unsupported entries if necessary, after entering the name and password you receive from your VPN provider and a name for the newly created profile you can use VPN by using the toolbar again to activate the VPN there.

OVERVIEW.P1: Instead of Tor you can also use other VPN providers for IP anonymization that support the OpenVPN protocol. Please note that you may incur additional costs through alternative VPN providers.
OVERVIEW.P2_PRE: We have already tested some VPN providers for compatibility and
OVERVIEW.P3_PRE: Basically, however, most OpenVPN providers should work without problems. If you still have problems with your provider, please share this in the forum.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Virtual Private Network (VPN)

OVERVIEW.P1: If your VPN provider offers a bi-directional keep-alive monitoring of the VPN connection, an additional active monitoring is not necessary.
OVERVIEW.P2: However, some VPN providers drop inactive connections or use unusual keep-alive configurations. This may go unnoticed by the eBlocker, if the connection is not actively monitored. If you encounter connection problems, you can enable active monitoring here.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Active monitoring of VPN connection

OVERVIEW.P1: The eBlocker checks your subnetwork for new devices about every 10 seconds. You can run this check less frequently or not at all and start it manually if necessary. Please note that after arrival at home the mobile phone may have to be recognized by the eBlocker before it can access the Internet via WLAN. The actual search rate depends on the size of your local network and may differ from the times specified.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Device Discovery

ADDITIONAL.P1: For example, you can individually set the HTTPS support, the functionality of the blocks, the behavior of the eBlocker Icon, the provision of anonymization, the notifications about system events.

DETAILS.P1: The devices are first identified by their IP address and by the manufacturer or MAC address. At the beginning of each row there is a button with which the eBlocker can be turned on and off for the respective device. A click on a row opens the detailed view of the device. You can assign a name to each device in the detail view and adjust the eBlocker individually.
DETAILS.P2: In the detailed view you can see more information about the hardware, e.g. the MAC address. eBlocker can be enabled and disabled or paused for any standard device. If the eBlocker is in the individual network settings, the same IP address can always be assigned to the device. Almost all functions of the eBlocker can be switched on and off for the standard devices.

OVERVIEW.P1: The list of all devices that the eBlocker has detected in the local network so far. At the beginning of each table row, the eBlocker can be activated or deactivated for the respective device. By clicking on a row, you can call up the details of the respective device and adjust the eBlocker settings for the device individually.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Device List

OVERVIEW.P1: The eBlocker DNS Server can be used to create your own meaningful entries for the home network. This allows you to name controllable devices in your home network via a web interface and call them up more quickly.
OVERVIEW.P2: Instead of setup.eBlocker.org or its IP address, the eBlocker can then be reached under eblocker.box, for example.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Local network

OVERVIEW.P1: Here you can create a list of DNS servers from external providers you trust. Enter the IPv4 address of the desired DNS server directly using the "{{'ADMINCONSOLE.DNS_SERVER.ACTION.ADD' | translate }}" button. To remove an entry, select "{{'ADMINCONSOLE.TABLE.ACTION.EDIT' | translate }}", select the row and select "{{'ADMINCONSOLE.DNS_SERVER.ACTION.REMOVE' | translate:{num: 'x'}:'messageformat' }}".
OVERVIEW.TITLE: DNS server sist

OVERVIEW.P1: The DNS system translates human-readable server names into IP addresses. DNS servers are responsible for this implementation. However, this information can also be used for attacks if deliberately wrong DNS entries are delivered.
OVERVIEW.P2: You can activate the DNS server of eBlocker and then access further settings. The following modes are available for the eBlocker DNS service:
OVERVIEW.P3_TEXT: – Forwarding to the router or the standard DNS server of the Internet provider.
OVERVIEW.P4_TEXT: – all requests are routed over the Tor network, even if Tor is not active for the device itself. The resolution of DNS queries over the Tor network may be slower.
OVERVIEW.P5_TEXT: – enter the DNS server of your choice here. There are providers that guarantee the privacy of your DNS requests.
OVERVIEW.P6: Using the button "{{ 'ADMINCONSOLE.DNS_STATUS.ACTION.EMPTY_CACHE' | translate }}" you can delete cached entries that may otherwise be kept for longer after you have changed the settings.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Domain Name Server (DNS)

OVERVIEW.P1: On this page, you configure advanced filtering methods whose application should be accompanied by in-depth knowledge of the underlying functions.
OVERVIEW.P2: A description of the individual settings can be found by clicking on the ? immediately after the name of the option. You can toggle the setting by selecting the desired setting from the drop-down list in the '{{'ADMINCONSOLE.ADVANCED_FILTER_SETTINGS.TABLE.COLUMN.VALUE' | translate }}' column.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Advanced settings

OVERVIEW.P1: The Google Captive Portal Check is used by Android, Chrome and Chromebooks to test whether an Internet connection exists. Your IP address and other data will be sent to the Google Captive Portal.
OVERVIEW.P2: The eBlocker blocks the connection to the Google Captive Portal, because otherwise your IP address will be collected by Google.
OVERVIEW.P3: Activate this option if Android devices are frequently disconnected from your WLAN.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Captive Portal Check

OVERVIEW.P1: The eBlocker must decompress web pages and Javascript files to insert its icon or block WebRTC. Recompressing the content may cause a slight delay. As no speed advantage from compression is to be expected in local networks, it can also be dispensed with there. eBlocker Mobile users, on the other hand, can benefit from this, since the data is sent over the Internet again.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Compression

OVERVIEW.P1: Some ads cannot be blocked by the Ad Blocker but can be hidden in the browser. This does not improve privacy.
OVERVIEW.P2: Scriptlets can prevent JavaScript in the browser from fingerprinting, detecting ad blocking and showing in-video ads.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Video Ads & Content Blocker

OVERVIEW.P1: Do-Not-Track (DNT) is an HTTP header field that signals to a website that the visitor does not want the website to create a usage profile.
OVERVIEW.P2: Unfortunately, this wish of the user is not binding and is therefore ignored by many websites.
OVERVIEW.P3: The eBlocker will still set this field in all requests, unless you explicitly disable it here.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Do-Not-Track

OVERVIEW.P1: Malware are blocked by a specific list updated frequently.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Malware Blocker

OVERVIEW.P1: Trackers and ads are blocked by pattern recognition in web requests with the help of daily updated lists. We recommend that you activate the automatic updates of your eBlocker.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Pattern Blocker for Tracker and Ads

OVERVIEW.P1: Trackers and ads are blocked directly by the DNS firewall. We recommend that you activate the automatic updates of your eBlocker.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Domain Blocker for Tracker and Ads

OVERVIEW.P1: By using the referrer headers, websites can partially track your surfing habits. Some websites also use the referrer headers for internal purposes. Blocking the referrer headers can therefore result in some pages no longer being displayed correctly.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: HTTP Referrer Header

OVERVIEW.P1: This page shows the filter groups (Ad, Tracker, Malware) and for which devices they are active. More block lists can be added in each group.
OVERVIEW.P2: The Domain Ad and Tracker Blockers work only on devices for which eBlocker HTTPS is not active. They always block all URLs of a domain.
OVERVIEW.P3: The Pattern Ad and Tracker Blockers work only on devices that have eBlocker HTTTPS enabled. They filter URL-exactly / domain independent and based on patterns in Easylist format (e.g. */badtracker.php). The exact pattern format can be found here.
OVERVIEW.P4: Blockers whose status display is red are active on one of your devices. In the column '{{'ADMINCONSOLE.FILTER_OVERVIEW.TABLE.COLUMN.DEVICES' | translate }}' you can move the mouse over the first displayed device and in an automatically opened info bubble you can see the devices on which the respective blocker is activated. The '{{'ADMINCONSOLE.FILTER_OVERVIEW.TABLE.COLUMN.NUM_BLOCKED' | translate }}' column provides information about the total number of blocked displays or trackers.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Blocker overview

OVERVIEW.P1: WebRTC is a browser technology that enables real-time communication between two parties. It is used, for example, for Internet telephony and chat.
OVERVIEW.P2: Unfortunately, WebRTC reveals your real IP address (and even your local LAN IP) to establish the connections. Even when using Tor or a VPN (IP anonymization), you can be identified by your real IP address if WebRTC is not blocked.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: WebRTC

DETAILS.P1: When you activate eBlocker for the first time, you will always find the license key in the box of your new device on a separate card.
DETAILS.P2: After a factory reset of the eBlocker, the license must also be removed from the device on the license server. To do this, follow the link "Transfer license" and enter the e-mail address used when you first activated the software on the website that opens.
DETAILS.P3_POST: . Have the eBlocker serial number and your license key ready.
DETAILS.P3_PRE: If you no longer have access to this e-mail address or you have purchased a used eBlocker, please post a note in the forum

OVERVIEW.P1: Status display of your most recent eBlocker license used on this device. You can enter your new license key and thus activate it, via external pages you can remove/transfer the current license key from the device or buy a new one.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: License

OVERVIEW.P1: Status display of your eBlocker operating system and block list versions. The eBlocker Pro and Family receive regularly updated blocker lists and all eBlockers receive bug fixes and system updates as needed. We recommend a daily automatic update. This is only executed with a valid, active license. You can set a desired start time for the update process for the update period.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Updates

OVERVIEW.P1: Check the most important data of your personal eBlocker certificate here. You can store the certificate manually or with the help of our assistant and renew the certificate if necessary. After renewing the certificate, it has to be stored again on all devices in order to use the HTTPS support.
OVERVIEW.P2: With the button "{{ 'ADMINCONSOLE.SSL_CERTIFICATE.ACTION.HTTPS_WIZARD' | translate}}" the current or renewed certificate can be stored with the support of the assistant. Just follow the instructions provided by the assistant.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: HTTPS Certificate

OVERVIEW.P1: In the HTTPS Connection Errors section, you can examine the data stream of individual applications with a simple tool and, if necessary, create exceptions if an app or a Web page does not work correctly when SSL support is activated. The recorded HTTPS connection errors help you determine which apps are affected and which domain/IP addresses should be defined as exceptions for the respective app.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Communication Failures

OVERVIEW.P1: With manual HTTPS diagnostics, it is possible to record other errors in addition to those found under "HTTPS Connection Errors" and add them to the list of trusted apps.
OVERVIEW.P2: Use the list buttons to select the device from your network where the errors occur, the maximum recording time and the maximum size of the protocol. Default: 5 minutes, 100 MB.
OVERVIEW.P3: Now use the app on the selected device where errors occur. After automatic or manual stop of the recording the eBlocker creates a list of the called domain names and the connected IP addresses, the used protocol and the eBlocker rules for you. In the last column you can agree or disagree with the recommended rule issued by eBlocker.
OVERVIEW.P4: The table rows of the analyzed connections can be adjusted individually for each called domain by clicking on them.
OVERVIEW.P5: You can test the recorded apps and add a new app definition for the list of trusted apps.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Recording Tool

OVERVIEW.P1: Enabling HTTPS support:
OVERVIEW.P2: If the button is green and the text states "{{'ADMINCONSOLE.SSL_STATUS.SWITCH.SSL_ON' | translate}}", you have activated this option. The eBlocker now accepts encrypted communication, decrypts it and checks it for trackers and tracking advertisements. The data stream is then re-encrypted with the eBlocker certificate. With this technology, tracking advertisements and trackers can be blocked even more efficiently.
OVERVIEW.P3: Store the certificate required for this process:
OVERVIEW.P4: If the HTTPS support is activated, the "{{ 'ADMINCONSOLE.SSL_STATUS.ACTION.HTTPS_WIZARD' | translate}}" button opens the assistant that will guide you through the certificate installation process.
OVERVIEW.P5: If you are familiar with handling certificates, you can also download them manually from the "Certificate" tab and store them in the certificate store for trusted certification authorities. Both procedures are described for the most common systems on the "{{'ADMINCONSOLE.SSL_STATUS.ACTION.TUTORIALS' | translate}}" link.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: HTTPS Support

OVERVIEW.P1: If individual apps are not compatible with eBlocker, you can exclude these apps from eBlocker protection.
OVERVIEW.P2: The eBlocker team has already activated some apps as exceptions by default to improve the user experience. You can revoke exceptions at any time.
OVERVIEW.P3: Please note that activated exception lists mean that the corresponding apps and websites are not protected by eBlocker.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Trusted Apps

OVERVIEW.P1: If individual websites are not compatible with eBlocker, you can exclude these websites from eBlocker protection.
OVERVIEW.P2: Please note that activated exception lists mean that the corresponding apps and websites are not protected by eBlocker.
OVERVIEW.P3: The recorded HTTPS connection errors help you determine which apps are affected and which domain/IP addresses should be defined as exceptions for the respective app.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Trusted Websites

DETAILS.P1: Start the wizard for setting up eBlocker Mobile using the "Change settings" button under Configuration at the bottom of the page.
DETAILS.P2: The wizard for setting up eBlocker Mobile is intended to create the following prerequisites for using the function: Access to your eBlocker from outside is established. If your router can be reached from the Internet with a static IP address, enter it. If you can only be reached from the Internet with a different IP address, you need a Dynamic DNS service to establish a fixed access to your home network. eBlocker Open Source provides you with such a service for an initial test.
DETAILS.P3: If a fixed access point is established from the Internet, your router must determine an information channel / "port" for the eBlocker under External access to your eBlocker, which can be used for communication. You can do this yourself or use the setup wizard if you have activated the "Universal Plug and Play" function on the router. Port forwarding must be set up in the router that connects your local network to the Internet: Port 1194 (protocol UDP) must be forwarded to the IP address eBlockers with the same port number 1194. We recommend assigning a fixed IP address to the eBlocker in the network settings.
DETAILS.P4: The last step of the connection test wizard allows you to test the connection you have just created.
DETAILS.P5_LINK_TEXT: More information about the OpenVPN Apps
DETAILS.P5_PRE: On your mobile phone you need an app to access your home network via OpenVPN. The eBlocker provides an OpenVPN configuration file for the OpenVPN connection from your mobile device, which you can download and use to contact the eBlocker.

OVERVIEW.P1: With the eBlocker Mobile function you can protect your mobile devices, such as mobile phones, tablets and notebooks, with your own eBlocker. To do this, you have to make the eBlocker accessible with a few settings on the router and the respective mobile device.
OVERVIEW.P2: eBlocker Mobile is currently only compatible with IPv4 networks. In the upper part of the page you can switch the eBlocker Mobile function on and off and you will see an overview of the currently selected settings. These can only be tested and changed as long as eBlocker Mobile has not been switched on.
OVERVIEW.P3: In the section Connection Test you can check the currently selected settings after configuring the eBlocker Mobile function.
OVERVIEW.P4: Before you can use the eBlocker Mobile function, the wizard, which you can call up in the Configuration section, helps you to select the correct settings. To do this, simply click Change settings to launch the setup wizard.
OVERVIEW.P5: You will find our step-by-step instructions on the "Details" tab.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: eBlocker Mobile

DETAILS.P1: Under Network Mode you will find the button for starting a wizard, which you can use to set the eBlocker to individual settings or expert mode.
DETAILS.P2: In the individual settings, the eBlocker assigns the IP addresses in the network. To do this, the DHCP service of the router must be switched off. The eBlocker takes over this service and configures it automatically.
DETAILS.P3: In expert mode for experienced users, the eBlocker has a fixed IP address. You can change the settings of the eBlocker DHCP service individually.
DETAILS.P4: Your current network settings show the settings currently used by eBlocker.
DETAILS.P5: If the eBlocker is in individual mode, you can manually set the IP addresses for the eBlocker and the gateway to the Internet by clicking on the "{{'ADMINCONSOLE.NETWORK_SETTINGS.ACTION.EDIT' | translate }}" button.
DETAILS.P6: If the eBlocker is in expert mode, you can set the IP addresses of the eBlocker and the gateway as well as the network mask and the address range of the DHCP service. If new devices in your home network should generally have a fixed IP address, this can also be activated here. This is advantageous, for example, if file or folder shares exist on the devices, or if it is a network printer that should always be accessible at the same address.

OVERVIEW.P1: You can normally keep the settings accessible here.
OVERVIEW.P2_POST: page, and on the advice of Customer Support, you can change the settings. Please note that you also need access to the settings of your Internet router at the same time in order to complete the configuration there.
OVERVIEW.P2_PRE: For a few special cases, which you can find on the
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Network

OVERVIEW.P1: These categories of expressly prohibited sites may be used in the Parental Controls rules for children to prevent access to those sites.
OVERVIEW.P2: eBlocker provides a selection of predefined categories that are updated automatically on a regular basis. You can also create and manage your own new categories by adding domain names.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Web Site Blacklists

DETAILS.P1: To facilitate your initial setup, a few examples of protection profiles have already been created. All you have to do here is assign the appropriate users so that parental controls are activated.
DETAILS.P2: Note: The default profile is automatically assigned to all new and existing devices. This also applies to equipment brought by other children (e.g. friends or guests). The fragFINN protection profile only allows access to the pages checked and approved by the fragFINN team with a preset daily usage time of 2 hours.

OVERVIEW.P1: A Parental Controls profile can be created for specific user groups, e.g. one for children. You use the protection profile to determine which website categories are to be blocked for this group (e.g. pornography, gambling). You can also specify when and for how long users can access the Internet. The profile is then assigned to the respective users.
OVERVIEW.P2: Important: For activation, the respective protection profile must then be assigned to the users and the users to the corresponding devices to which they have access (e.g. Smartphone, Kind1, Smart TV, game console, etc.).
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Parental Controls Profiles

OVERVIEW.P1: The eBlocker parental controls are based on users-profiles who are assigned age-appropriate rights based on the role (parents / children / guests) and the date of birth. If desired, the parent profile can be shared to simplify administration.
OVERVIEW.P2: After clicking on an entry in the table of users, many additional settings can be edited, in particular the blocked content, the total duration of internet usage allowed per weekday and the usage period per day. Each user can be assigned a device, which is therefore subject to the corresponding rules for the protection of minors. If necessary, another user can temporarily take possession of a device to temporarily activate stricter or less strict rules. A PIN can be set for easy user switching.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: User

OVERVIEW.P1: These categories of explicitly allowed websites can be used in the Parental Controls rules for children to allow access to the respective websites.
OVERVIEW.P2: You can create and edit individual categories of allowed websites by adding or removing domain names as needed.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Whitelists

OVERVIEW.LINK_TEXT: What to do in case of errors?
OVERVIEW.P1: Port forwarding redirects incoming requests from one address and port combination to another when the packets are routed through a network's gateway.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Port forwarding

OVERVIEW.P1: Without assigning an admin password, anyone with access to your network can change the settings of the eBlocker. The activation of the parental controls always requires the creation of a password. To assign a password, it must be entered twice. The security of the password is evaluated.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Admin Password

OVERVIEW.P1: Here you can save your personal, trustworthy apps and websites created in the HTTPS settings and import them again if necessary.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Save Settings

OVERVIEW.P1: Should problems occur in your network or with your eBlocker, please use our community forum. After starting report generation, it may take a while for the dialog box with the question about the location to open. If you have specified a fixed file location, the dialog box may not open and you may need to look for the .tgz file. Please upload the file only on request.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Diagnostics

OVERVIEW.P1: You receive an overview of the system-relevant events that have occurred.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Events

OVERVIEW.TITLE: Factory Reset

OVERVIEW.P1: Both functions can be called via the buttons. We recommend always shutting down the eBlocker before disconnecting it from the power supply.
OVERVIEW.TITLE: Reboot and Shutdown
